title: Harinaam Diksha 2025 | Ritvik Initiation Ceremony Lecture | His Grace Jai Chaitanya Dasa
speaker: HG Jai Chaitanya Dasa

segments.key_quote: So, having come here, this is an opportunity for us to revive the Krishna Consciousness, which is as a Swaroopa of the spirit soul.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the concept of Diksha, explaining its components (Divya Gyan and Papakshaya) and its importance in the process of liberation and reviving Krishna Consciousness within the Brahma Madhva Gaudiya Parampara.
segments.transcript: Hare Krishna and welcome to all the candidates for the first and the second initiation ceremony. As per the system given by Srila Prabhupada, as per his last wish, Diksha, how many are first initiation here? First initiation, right. So, Diksha, you may know already, comes from two words, sounds, Di and Ksha. Di represents Divya Gyan. And Ksha is Papakshaya. Two things which is primarily needed for returning home back to Krishna. All of you know that we are in a place which is unsuitable for us. Us meaning the spirit soul, not as the body, not as the mind, or not as the ego, what we have assumed. So, this is not the place for the living entities to be in, because he should be with Krishna. He should be associating with Krishna and his paraphernalia. But unfortunately, we are here in this material world. And the process of liberation has already started by us coming in touch with this Brahma Madhva Gaudiya Parampara.

segments.key_quote: Knowledge is there, but the Vijnana, the realised knowledge. Realising the knowledge by practice. Making the knowledge a reality. That is Divya Gyan.
segments.summary: This segment elaborates on the difference between theoretical knowledge (Gyan) and realized knowledge (Vijnana), emphasizing the need to move beyond superficial understanding and practice Krishna Consciousness to overcome Karma and engage in constitutional activities.
segments.transcript: The most sacred, live, vibrant, practising Parampara in the Vaishnava system. So, having come here, this is an opportunity for us to revive the Krishna Consciousness, which is as a Swaroopa of the spirit soul. So, to go back to our original position, the two most important aspect is the Gyan, Divya Gyan. Knowledge about our original position. Gyan does not mean just material or theoretical understanding, superficial understanding. All of us know Krishna, the Supreme Personality of Godhead. All of us have heard, we are not the body. All of us know we have to go back to him, but we are not able to go back to him. So, knowledge is there, but the Vijnana, the realised knowledge. Realising the knowledge by practice. Making the knowledge a reality. That is Divya Gyan. Realised knowledge. Ten Brahma Hridayat, like Brahma, realised. So, this realisation happens in the heart, not in the memory. So, this Divya Gyan is one of the components required to go back to the original position. But for that, the stopping, what is stopping us is the Karma, which is due to Papa. So, this building up of this Papa is there, which is stopping us from knowing the Jnana, which is stopping us from performing the original constitutional activities. Now, we are performing conditional activities. Those activities which we are made to do in this condition. Sometimes we are in human condition, we do human activities. We are in animal condition, you do animal activities. So, these are conditional activities. Even the activities we may do in Varna and Ashram are also conditional activities. Brahmanas, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, Shudras, Abramacharis, Sanyasis, these are all conditional. Constitutional activity, Nitya Seva. The constitutional activity is Krishna Consciousness. Krishna Consciousness, Bhakti, performance of devotional service to the Supreme Lord.

segments.key_quote: So, by the process of proper Diksha, one is supposed to develop Divya Gyan, one is able to burn his Papa, all by the grace of the spiritual master, who is at the lotus feet of Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker explains how Diksha helps in developing Divya Gyan and burning Papa (sins) through the grace of the spiritual master, emphasizing the importance of surrender (Saranagati) and determination as prerequisites for Diksha.
segments.transcript: So, that is the constitutional activity of the soul. And what is stopping that is our conditional situation, which is due to Papa. The covering of the soul, build up covering, subtle covering and the gross covering. So, by the process of proper Diksha, one is supposed to develop Divya Gyan, one is able to burn his Papa, all by the grace of the spiritual master, who is at the lotus feet of Krishna. So, taking shelter of such a spiritual master, taking shelter of this Acharya, who is dear to Krishna, who has come to us by good fortune and by the mercy of this personality. So, that is the opportunity we have in this decision you all have made by taking this determination. So, Diksha is a beginning process. It is not an end process. By Diksha, one gets opportunity for this purification. Yes, there are certain qualifications, qualifications needed. Some qualification needed to get Diksha. Just like if you want to be a doctor, you should have a pre-university degree. With your SSLC or a matriculation, you cannot enter a MBBS college. So, there is a pre-requirement of getting something to get into this college. So, this is like an admission, which guarantees that you will become a doctor. But by admission, you don't become a doctor. Similarly, by Diksha, you don't become pure. It is a pre-requisite to become pure. And for Diksha, there are also pre-requirements. So, having qualified for Diksha, which is what? Qualification of Diksha is the determination. Determination to follow. Determination to serve. Determination to give up. Determination to surrender.

segments.key_quote: Unless he considers himself as a devotee of my devotee. That is the process. That is the principle.
segments.summary: This segment delves deeper into the concept of Saranagati (full surrender), highlighting the need to give up personal requirements and dedicate oneself to satisfying the spiritual master's wishes, emphasizing that spiritual knowledge is under the control of a personality (Krishna) unlike material knowledge which is system-based.
segments.transcript: Saranagati. So, then what is Saranagati? Full surrender. Irrespective of any personal needs, personal requirements, care for person. So, a devotee who is taking Diksha, who is desiring to go back to Godhead, who is desiring to serve the spiritual master, has to first understand that he is ready to give up his own requirements. Unless we are ready to give up our own requirements, we cannot surrender 100% to the spiritual master and 100% dedicate our life to satisfy his wishes. Why? Because the Supreme Lord has wished that anybody who comes back to him should come through his pure devotees. As Krishna has explained in Adi Purana, anybody who considers himself as my devotee, I don't consider him as a devotee, unless he considers himself as a devotee of my devotee. That is the process. That is the principle. So, to satisfy the devotee of the Supreme Lord, one surrenders to him. And it's a very personal philosophy. This is not a mechanical philosophy that okay, I studied five years in engineering college, I have to get a certificate if I pass. I have gone through five years of doctorate, I have to become doctorate. I have done my research, I have to get. But here I have done everything, read Bhagavatam ten thousand times, I may not get Krishna. That is the difference. Material knowledge and spiritual knowledge, because spiritual knowledge is under the control of a personality.

segments.key_quote: In spiritual system, one cannot get Krishna without pleasing the servant of Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the impersonal nature of material knowledge with the personal connection required in the spiritual system, emphasizing that pleasing the servant of Krishna through genuine surrender of mind, words, and actions is essential for attaining Krishna.
segments.transcript: Material knowledge is a control of a system. You go through the system, it doesn't matter who you are. You are able to vomit everything that is in the book, you will get. But here, vomiting won't help. Here, proper personal connection with Krishna. You have a connection with professor or a dean, doesn't matter. He may say yes sir, and behind him he will say so many other things. It doesn't matter. It's not a personal connection. Even though in many of the tradition knowledge, personal connection is important. You take any of those Vaidika knowledge, Natya Shastra, or any of those things also, the blessing of the teacher, blessing of the guru, this is a system in the Vedic system, not in the modern system. But spiritual system is totally different. In spiritual system, one cannot get Krishna without pleasing the servant of Krishna. Now pleasing the servant of Krishna does not mean simply shaking your head in front of him. Yes, yes, yes. It is not a tongue service. It is a service. It is surrender of one's heart. So one has to Manasa Vacha Karvana, by one's mind, by one's words, and by one's action, have to surrender to the personality and not only surrender up to the personality, make sure that the personality is satisfied. That is a requirement to get Krishna. So there is a system, but there is a very, very deep personal connection. That personal connection makes us qualified

segments.key_quote: I am not available. Even if you are a great intelligent person, you are a great orator, you are a great Vedic person, I am available only if I allow you to be.
segments.summary: This segment discusses Krishna's independent will and how He is only attainable through His grace, emphasizing the need to accept Krishna as a 'transcendental autocrat' and highlighting the spiritual master's blessing as armor in the fight against Maya.
segments.transcript: to be accepted by Krishna. As Prabhupada quotes from Upanishad, many times, what is that verse? Naaham Naaham labhyo pravachanena labhya Naayam atma pravachanena labhya Na medhaya bahudha suthena. I am not available. Even if you are a great intelligent person, you are a great orator, you are a great Vedic person, I am available only if I allow you to be. No? I allow myself to be available to you. So this is Krishna's demand. So he is called transcendental autocrat. And we are all against autocrats in this material world, right? Nobody likes autocrat. Everybody blames you, he is an autocrat. Krishna is an autocrat. Can you accept that? Yes. If we can accept Krishna is autocrat, and his wish goes, nothing but his wish, then we are ready. So this is a preparation to get that consciousness. Deeksha is a preparation to get that consciousness. Deeksha allows us to get that consciousness. Why? Because once we have the blessing of the spiritual master, then we are not fighting alone. The world is like a fight. Fighting against maya, fighting against the current. So if you are alone, it's difficult. We need to have equipments. We have to be properly armed when we are fighting, right? The same way, the arm, the armor, that's the blessing of the spiritual master.

segments.key_quote: Block, stock and barrel you have to accept.
segments.summary: Using the analogy of a girl wanting to marry a person but disliking his family, the speaker emphasizes the need to accept Krishna and His entire paraphernalia, highlighting surrender as accepting Krishna's interests and Diksha as the beginning of this learning process.
segments.transcript: So a military kivgamesh said this last time, in the holy name of the Lord, the bhagavata, person bhagavata, and the philosophy bhagavatata, we are entering a very very personal arena, just like a girl wants to marry a person. You cannot say, I'll take Krishna but I don't like this, I don't like that. No. Block, stock and barrel you have to accept. So one has to understand that one is entering the whole. segments.key_quote: What makes us qualified surrendered soul is what quantum of time and energy we spend for the absolute cause.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the duties of Grihasthas, emphasizing the importance of proportionately dedicating their earnings and time to the spiritual master's cause, highlighting that true surrender is measured by the quantum of time and energy spent for the absolute cause, and Diksha is the beginning of this journey.

segments.key_quote: What is intelligent is understanding that I am in an unnecessary business and enter the real business, which gives real bliss, real happiness, real connection with our relations.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing that taking Diksha is the most intelligent decision because it leads one from the 'drainage' of material life to the 'main road' of spiritual life, offering real bliss, happiness, and connection with Krishna and His devotees, contrasting it with the temporary and ultimately unsatisfying pursuits of the material world.
segments.transcript: deities, we take a pledge to dedicate. But according to Prabhupada, this is the most intelligent decision one takes. The most intelligent decision. Why? When you come to know that I am walking through the drain and somebody says, this is drain, dirty place. You are walking through, this is the road. Having come to know the dirty road, he gets into the proper path. So now we are driving on the main road. Till now we were driving on the drainage. Most intelligent person. Why? He doesn't work like a donkey in this material world for material causes. So one has to balance his life, his material requirements and keep spiritual requirement as a priority and step by step, if you follow this process, Gropa is already guaranteed as shelter of Krishna. Why all these things? To get the ultimate shelter which gives us Satchitananda, the state of eternity, the state of shelter and permanent bliss, not material bliss, not temporary bliss. Permanent happiness. So if you want to experience the happiness of the soul, Atma Ramaha, self-sufficiently blissful soul, satisfied in himself, in service of the Supreme Lord. So that is the position we are trying to get. That is why it is called intelligent. Rather than in this material world, somehow or the other trying to get happy, despite of all the difficulties, crossed difficulties, and after all these things, the man thinks, he's a hero. I've made it in this material world. That is where Gropa says, this is like a camel chewing the thorn. Finally, he's only testing his blood.
